    • clueGame.Board

extends java.lang.Object
    Board Class - Sets up Board and finds adjacencies and targets.
    Author:
    Alexander Chu, Joseph O'Brien

      • loadRoomConfig

        public void loadRoomConfig()
                    throws clueGame.BadConfigFormatException
        Loads in the legend from text file. Puts the elements in a map to represent the legend.
        Throws:
        clueGame.BadConfigFormatException - If the format of the legend is not correct

      • loadBoardConfig

        public void loadBoardConfig()
                     throws clueGame.BadConfigFormatException
        Loads in the game board and sets up the game board. Creates an array of BoardCell the represents the game board. Determines if the cell is a door and defines the direction.
        Throws:
        clueGame.BadConfigFormatException - If the board is not formated correctly

        b - Column number
        Returns:
        all adjacent cells for a given cell

      • getTargets

        public java.util.Set<clueGame.BoardCell> getTargets()
        Getter for targets
        Returns:
        the cells that the can be moved to.

      • calcAdjacencies

        public void calcAdjacencies()
        Calculates the adjacencies for the whole game board. Recognizes the cannot move within room, Only move in one direction from door, and can only enter rooms through a door.

      • calcTargets

        public void calcTargets(int a,
                        int b,
                        int pathLength)
        Calls calcTargets for a certain location on the game board.
        Parameters:
        a - row number
        b - column number
        pathLength - number of steps

      • calcTargets

        public void calcTargets(clueGame.BoardCell startCell,
                        int pathLength)
        Calculates all targets for a given cell and certain distance.
        Parameters:
        startCell - starting position
        pathLength - number of steps
